intro: Chasea flexilis, commonly known as the flexible grassvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and riparian areas. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often branched and covered with fine, soft hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and arranged in dense clusters. Chasea flexilis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates in its native environment.
